verses.text: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, set to Shigionoth.

God came from Teman,
And the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah
His glory covered the heavens,
And the earth was full of his praise.

Before him went the pestilence,
And fiery bolts went forth at his feet.

I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction;
The curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.

Was Jehovah displeased with the rivers?
Was thine anger against the rivers,
Or thy wrath against the sea,
That thou didst ride upon thy horses,
Upon thy chariots of salvation?

The sun and moon stood still in their habitation,
At the light of thine arrows as they went,
At the shining of thy glittering spear.

Thou didst march through the land in indignation;
Thou didst thresh the nations in anger.

Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people,
For the salvation of thine anointed;
Thou woundest the head out of the house of the wicked man,
Laying bare the foundation even unto the neck. Selah

Thou didst tread the sea with thy horses,
The heap of mighty waters.

Yet I will rejoice in Jehovah,
I will joy in the God of my salvation.

Jehovah, the Lord, is my strength;
And he maketh my feet like hindsâ€™ feet,
And will make me to walk upon my high places.
For the Chief Musician, on my stringed instruments.
